Hirsch Academy will be closed for a minimum of two weeks, and we hope to reopen to our students on March 30th. This is a unified effort to minimize the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Governor Ducey and Superintendent Hoffman announced that all Arizona schools will be closed for two weeks starting March 16th and extending until at least March 27th.
We are continuing to serve bagged lunch from 10:00 am to 2:00 pm to all students who would like to pick one up at the City of Scottsdale Paiute office.
Additionally you will see a blue bin with printed academic materials divided by grade level for you to take. Please pick up some reading and math practice pages to bring home and encourage your students to practice their academic skills while we have this extended break.
We are also providing some supplies like pencils, crayons and notebooks while students are working from home.
Please send any specific requests, questions or concerns to gdisipio@hirschaz.org
